channel.title: demorgan's theorem on Notes
channel.description: Recent content in demorgan's theorem on Notes

item.title: CS137-lecture-20210209
item.description:
Ch2.pdf LUT = lookup table SOP = sum of products DeMorgan’s theorem # Two or more variables NAND’d together is the same as the two terms inverted and OR’d Two or more variables NOR’d together is the same as the two variables inverted and AND’d together Lets show this via tables for these two equations: \[ egin{aligned} F1 &= F2 \ 
eg(A \cdot B) &= 
eg A + 
eg B \end{aligned}\] Here is a table for \(F1\) :

item.title: CS137-lecture-20210223
item.description:
CS137-lecture-20210223 # DeMorgan’s Theorem # Theorem 1: \(
eg(x \cdot y) = 
eg x + 
eg y\) Theorem 2: \(
eg(x + y) = 
eg x \cdot 
eg y\) Steps to convert to all NAND gates: Replace each NOT gate with its equivalent NAND gate. Connecting the inputs of a NAND gate makes a NOT gate. Place two NOT gates on each of signals going into the final OR.
